intro: Leandra papillata, commonly known as the hairy leandra, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and large, showy flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs. Leandra papillata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and greenhouses due to its striking appearance and relatively easy care requirements.
